summary:
{
  "summary": "The ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...",
  "business_intent": ... etc...
We need to produce JSON with summary, business_intent, keywords list.

We have file-level metadata: test file for nesting setup in roms_tools. It imports various functions from roms_tools.setup.nesting and utils, and defines helper functions to create simple grids and nesting configurations. It also defines test classes for boundary distance, interpolation indices, mapping child boundaries, modifying child topography, and overall nesting behavior. The purpose is to verify correctness of nesting setup utilities.

Thus summary: This module contains unit tests for nesting setup utilities in ROMS tools, providing helper functions to create simple parent/child grids and nesting configurations, and test cases that validate boundary distance calculations, index interpolation, boundary mapping, topography modification, and overall nesting functionality.

Business intent: Ensure reliability of nesting configuration functions for ocean modeling, facilitating accurate grid nesting and topography handling.

Keywords: testing, unit tests, nesting, grid, ROMS, boundary distance, interpolation, mapping, topography, mask, parent grid, child grid, xarray, numpy, pytest.

Make sure not to list function names verbatim. Avoid verbatim names like baby_grid etc. Use generic description.

Now produce JSON.assistantfinal{
  "summary": "This module provides a suite of unit tests for the nesting setup utilities of the ROMS tools package. It defines lightweight helper routines to construct simple parent and child grid objects and nesting configurations, then exercises the core functions that compute distances to grid boundaries, interpolate index mappings, map child boundaries onto parent grid indices, adjust child topography and masks, and orchestrate the overall nesting process. The tests verify that these operations behave correctly under various geometric scenarios.",
  "business_intent": "Validate and safeguard the correctness of grid nesting preparation logic used in ocean modeling workflows, ensuring that boundary handling, index interpolation, and topography adjustments work reliably for downstream ROMS simulations.",
  "keywords": [
    "unit testing",
    "grid nesting",
    "ROMS",
    "boundary distance",
    "index interpolation",
    "boundary mapping",
    "topography modification",
    "mask handling",
    "parent grid",
    "child grid",
    "xarray",
    "numpy",
    "pytest"
  ]
}
